page.title: 02The Hamlet of Aldwark.
page.content:
Aldwark hamlet is situated in the SW of the area, and is the only concentration of population in the area.
The hamlet consists of five dairy farms and two cottages with no land. The land is held by old-established farming families, the farms being passed down from generation to generation. At the time of the survey, the former public house, the "Bull's Head", was being converted into a dwelling by the recently married daughter and son-in- law of a farmer in the hamlet,because they wished to remain in the area.During the conversion the couple are living in a caravan on the site. Most people in the area are middle-aged, and only one family has children of school age and younger.
